intro: Microcala, commonly known as the small calyx plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has finely divided leaves that resemble those of parsley, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Microcala is often found in moist, shaded environments in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to gardens and ecological studies.
